title: I would like a clarification from either the mods or the Holy Smiter, Himself...
body:
... about what Tantram wrote [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/jFwTE8Oj-playing-off-meta-in-ranked-int-feeding-ban?comment=0039) 

>You ban your teammates champ picks
You pick non-meta champs to tilt teammates
You build those non-meta champs as non-meta as possible (ad mages, etc)
You intentionally steal farm
You intentionally KS
You don't go to the lane assigned, and instead go to interfere with others
You leave your team when a teamfight breaks out

i was under the impression that 

1. banning allied picks is allowed and not against the rules

2. picking non meta and playing non meta was allowed because riot is supposedly not enforcing the meta on the playerbase

3. farm is not the property of any one lane per se (ex: the support can farm if he wants to _ and_ the lanes can farm the jungle minions at their discretion)

4. not going to the assigned lane was permitted to a fault under certain conditions (the duo going top instead or everyone going the season 1 setup)

5. you are allowed to stay back from a team fight if you judge your presence in said teamfight would not help your team's chances of winning it or you are splitpushing at the time.

can you guys clarify them for me? I apreciate it!

{{sticker:fiora-cool}}

replies.body:
Intent is the keyword here. 

That dude had the intent to troll for the sake of trolling. He's doing everything you mentioned for the sake of annoying others, which is not ok.

There's a fine line with doing all you mentioned without annoying others. That dude wasn't operating within that line.

>banning allied picks is allowed and not against the rules
>
>picking non meta and playing non meta was allowed because riot is supposedly not enforcing the meta on the playerbase
>
>farm is not the property of any one lane per se (ex: the support can farm if he wants to and the lanes can farm the jungle minions at their discretion)
>
>not going to the assigned lane was permitted to a fault under certain conditions (the duo going top instead or everyone going the season 1 setup)
>
>you are allowed to stay back from a team fight if you judge your presence in said teamfight would not help your team's chances of winning it or you are splitpushing at the time.

There are all correct in general.

If, however, someone consistently does all of these, that shows a tendency to intentionally soft-troll. If I ban an ally's pick and play never-teamfight bot-lane farming Support Singed in one or two games that's one thing -- if I do it in *every* game with the intention of causing my team to tilt, that's a problem.

Consider it like the chat restriction system. A bit of problematic behavior here and there is fine, but when it becomes a clear pattern of abuse there's an issue.

As Tantram said: _"Playing off meta is not trolling or griefing. Trolling or griefing is .. trolling or griefing."_

Ultimately, Riot *can* tell the difference.

i'm sorry but "they are allowed unless used all the time" does not make sense to me

something is either ok or it isn't

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0rh6PAJl,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-10-15T13:55:00.744+0000)i'm sorry but "they are allowed unless used all the time" does not make sense to me
> 
> something is either ok or it isn't

That's not really true. Things that are normally okay can be problematic if used for problematic purposes.

The words "kill" and "yourself" are both allowed in *League*, for example. When used to tell another player to kill themselves, however, they *become* problematic.

Playing off meta, banning an ally's pick, etc. are all okay. When *every game* you're banning an ally's pick, when *every game* you're playing hilariously off-meta with no regards for your team, and when *every game* you're running from *every teamfight*, there's an issue, and one that Riot can identify as different from acceptable off-meta play.

>Playing off meta, banning an ally's pick, etc. are all okay. When every game you're banning an ally's pick, when every game you're playing hilariously off-meta with no regards for your team, and when every game you're running from every teamfight, there's an issue, and one that Riot can identify as different from acceptable off-meta play.

but if your own personal objective is to win the game, albeit through unorthodox means, you are allowed to burn a few bridges along the way, yes?

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0rh6PAJl,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-15T14:01:59.539+0000)but if your own personal objective is to win the game, albeit through unorthodox means, you are allowed to burn a few bridges along the way, yes?

Sure. The difference is that if you cross into doing so antagonistically or for the *purpose* of burning bridges, there's a problem.

My personal process for playing off-meta (which I honestly love) is to tell my team what I'm going for up front. If there's a lot of push-back, I don't do it. So a typical game might be "Hey guys -- my buddy and I are planning on a Rengar/Pantheon bot lane." If I get a lot of pushback, we'll save that for another time. You'd be surprised at how often a simple "hey guys, this is our plan, let's work with that in mind" makes people be okay with it -- or sometimes even jump fully aboard and decide that all the Swain/Sion bottom lane means everyone needs to go FULL NOXIAN in EVERY lane.
